results.title: Mr. Holland's opus
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Robert W. Cort, Michael Nolin, Ted Field, PolyGram Film International and Interscope communications
results.brief_description: Richard Dreyfuss plays Glen Holland, a musician who falls into a temporary teaching position at J.F. Kennedy High and stays for 30 years. The opus he composes takes second place to his great work, that of enriching the lives of his students as they pass through his class. This is not a film about a hero who performs brave deeds; but of ordinary people in everyday settings who strive daily for excellence in their lives. Dreyfuss is ably supported by Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas and Olympia Dukakis. “Mr Holland’s opus” is a sentimental, warm film which will uplift the spirit.

results.title: The Anniversary
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Jimmy Sangster and Seven Arts-Hammer Film Productions
results.brief_description: An off-beat, devilish black comedy based on the popular stage play by Bill MacIlwraith. Bette Davis rules the roost as the matriach of a most unusual family. The mother of three grown sons, the one-eyed Mrs Taggart is a relentless dominatrix and will stop at nothing to keep her spineless offspring under her thumb. Although the husband she despised has been dead for ten years, she continues to observe her wedding anniversary by insisting that her sons return home for the celebration. However, this year they arrive with something else on their minds - independence from her grasp. Co-starring Sheila Hancock, Jack Hedley, Christian Roberts, James Cossins and Elaine Taylor.

results.title: Stage Fright
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Brothers First National Productions
results.brief_description: Drama student Eve Gill (Jane Wyman) envisions the acting challenge of a lifetime in the desperate predicament of boyfriend Jonathan Cooper (Richard Todd) who is framed for murder by the flamboyant stage star Charlotte Inwood (Marlene Dietrich). To prove Jonathan’s innocence, the naive Eve impersonates a maid and works for Charlotte but discovers that where murder is involved, life does not follow a script. Representing the glamour and bitchiness of the theatre, movie legend Marlene Dietrich makes the vain, manipulative Charlotte one of her most colourful characterisations and her rendition of Cole Porter’s “The Laziest gal in town” is both sexy and provocative. Co-starring Michael Wilding, Richard Todd, Alistair Sim, Sybil Thorndike, Joyce Grenfell and Kay Walsh. Based on a novel by Selwyn Jepson.

results.title: The Farmer's daughter
results.creator_credit: H C Potter, Dore Schary and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: Katie Holmstrom (Loretta Young in an Oscar winning performance) leaves her farm seeking a nursing career in Capitol City. She accepts a ride with sign-painter Adolph Petree, but a car accident forces them to spend a night at a motel while repairs are undertaken. Katie helps pay for damages and arrives in the City penniless. She works as a maid in the Morley household and impresses the Congressman and his family. Morley runs for re-election and wins, but his colleague dies soon after taking office, and the party nominates a political hack named Finley to replace him. Katie is furious, tells off Finley at a rally, drawing so much attention that the rival party drafts her as its darkhorse candidate, building her campaign on her refreshing honesty and openness. However, someone she once helped turns on her and threatens her new position. Co-starring Joseph Cotten, Ethel Barrymore, Charles Bickford and Rose Hobart. Adapted from the play Hulda: Daughter of Parliament by Juhni Tervata.

results.title: The Scarlet pimpernel
results.creator_credit: Clive Donner, David Conroy and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Sir Percy Blakeney, Baronet, alias “The Scarlett Pimpernel” was the literary creation of Baronet Orczy. Sir Percy’s escapades during the French Revolution, where he and his band of young English noblemen risk life and limb to rescue the ‘aristos’ from the clutches of the guillotine, are vividly brought to life in this film made for television. Anthony Andrews is the dashing and elegant Sir Percy, Jane Seymour plays his lovely French wife Marguerite and Ian McKellen is Chauvelin, Sir Percy’s arch enemy. The costumes are sumptuous and the dialogue witty.

results.title: Dead man walking
results.creator_credit: Tim Robbins, Rudd Simmons, John Kiuk, Havoc and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: In the role that won her an Academy Award, Susan Sarandon plays Sister Helen Prejean. Based on a true story and on the book written by Sister Prejean, the film deals with her relationship with convicted killer Matthew Poncelet. Convicted of the brutal murder of two teenagers, Poncelet waits on Death Row to end his life by lethal injection. Electing Sister Helen as his spiritual advisor, the film takes us on a journey from darkness into light as Matthew and Sister Prejean search for and face the truth. Robbins’ film is masterly and the performances of Sarandon and Sean Penn as Poncelot are compelling and moving. Robbins’ raises key issues in the film but never over-manipulates the audience to take one side or the other on the capital punishment issue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim Robbins, Rudd Simmons, John Kiuk, Havoc and Working Title Films

results.title: Daddy long legs
results.creator_credit: Jean Negulesco, Samuel G. Engel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1931 film, but greatly expanded to allow for the dancing of Fred Astaire and Leslie Caron. It is the story of a French orphan whose schooling is sponsored by an American millionaire on the stipulation that she will never know his identity. His secretary (Thelma Ritter) is so touched by her letters of gratitude, delivered by the school, that she persuades him to visit. He is enchanted by the elegant, lovely girl and falls in love with her - and she with him, without knowing who he is. The film contains a wide range of music including a jazz piece with drums by Astaire, a ballet danced by Caron, several dream sequences with Astaire imagining himself as a playboy and a rich cowboy, and Johnny Mercer’s memorable song Something’s Gotta Give.

results.title: The Fugitive
results.creator_credit: Andrew Davis, Arnold Kopelson, Keith Barish and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Fugitive, one of the most popular television series of the 1960’s was brought to the screen with Harrison Ford playing the role of Doctor Richard Kimble. Kimble, a Chicago surgeon, is falsely accused of murdering his wife. Convicted of the crime, he escapes from custody to pursue an unknown one-armed man, whom he knows is the killer. Hot on his trail is Sam Gerard, US Marshall, (Tommy Lee Jones), who won an Academy Award for this performance. Andrew Davis as director has created a thrilling, action-packed film which moves at a hectic pace towards the final moment when Kimble meets his man.

results.title: A River runs through it
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Patrick Markey and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Norman Maclean’s novel has been brought to life under the skillful direction of Robert Redford and fine performances by Tom Skerrit, Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer. Set in the mountain wilderness of Montana between 1910-1935, the story focuses on the relationship between two brothers. Their upbringing at the hands of their strict missionary father influences the boys to chose different paths. One brother goes down the road to success while the other’s path is filled with trouble and heartbreak. The two brothers share little in common except their passion for fly fishing which unites them.

results.title: The Bigamist
results.creator_credit: Ida Lupino, Collier Young, Republic Pictures Corporation and Filmmakers
results.brief_description: A childless couple, Harry (Edmund O’Brien) and Eve Graham (Joan Fontaine) apply to adopt a child in their home city of San Francisco. The meticulous adoption agent, Mr Jordan (Edmund Gwenn) suspects something is awry and investigates every corner of Harry’s life before approving the adoption. He soon discovers that Harry has another life and another wife (Ida Lupino) in Los Angeles. Before Jordan reports Harry to the police he listens to his story. Ida Lupino was one of the few women directors working regularly in Hollywood during the 50’s, 60’s and 70’s. She also produced and wrote for both film and television during this period. Her acting career spanned fifty years from the 1930s to the 1980s.
